text: Bottle at THT tasting. Old note. The aroma has caramel, cardamom, fruity tones. Bit hazy, amber-red coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is sweet, has caramel, spice. Nice one.
Beautiful beer! Soft and smooth taste with some caramel notes and flowery touches, full round taste that fills the whole palate. One of the best beers Ive tasted lately.

Brought back from San Francisco by my son - thanks! Medium copper pour, bone colored head, nice lacing. Aroma has a very subtle sourness to it, some cherry-like fruity sweetness. Solid flavor, some caramel sweetness, hints of cherry fruitiness. light underlying citrus bitterness, Thick, creamy mouthfeel. Solid amber ale, as expected from Alesmith.

Bottle. Pour is dark copper/tan with a large bubbly off-white head. Notes of pine resin, caramel sauce, semi-sweet fruit, and earth. Finish is very sweet but balanced nicely by the hop bitterness. Big flavor and mouthfeel for an amber ale.

Nice cider/ruby color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted caramel malt, pine hops, & fruit/citrus; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, caramel, spicy hops, fruit, and some nuts; Finish is dry & slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Good.

Well the color has moved to a light cola. The head is frothy and asmall amount of lacing but the beer was still a hopped full bodied beer. It has a small bitter note at the end but otherwise still great.

Bomber from Total Wine, West Richmond. Pours hazy amber-brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus hops, dark fruit, plastic, caramel. Flavor is dark fruit, caramel, pine, citrus peel, a bit doughy. I gotta say, not a huge fan.

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, pine, bread, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque red/brown beer with a medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange and pine; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Such a shame that the flavour only matches that beautiful aroma for a couple of seconds. Could have used more bitter hopping I presume.

Bottle. Pours light hazy amber with a small, staying creamy beige head. Aroma has fat caramel, resin, pine. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, doughy, crisp caramel, very bitter. Quite balanced.
Looks red. LOL. smells like am malty caramel red-ale.Very chewy doughy flavor with this crisp finish and piney notes
Bottle, 650ml. A dark reddish beer with a small head. Aroma is of floral hops, wood and alcohol. Taste is bitter with moderate carbonation. Aftertaste of caramel and roasted malts.

Bottle, 650ml. Clear reddish, creamy tan head. Aromas of floral hops, red fruits, caramel. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Fiery roasted and spicy flavors into a harsh finish.

Nice light nut brown/red color with off white head. Looks good. Lots of malty aroma (bread, cookie dough, caramel) and some ripe fruit aroma (raisins, dates) plus some hoppy grassiness. The taste is very malty flavorful and vinous. Lots of caramel, raisin and light toast notes. Finish is bitter, has grass notes, is lightly acidic, vinous and has some alcohol burn. Nice complexity. Had expected more hoppiness.

Appearance: Rich red copper. Mostly clear. finger of off white foam. 
Nose: medium roasted malts. Earthy, funky and pine hops. Light caramel
Taste: Initially bitter with pine hops. Medium malt body with caramel and bits of funk towards the end
Body: medium to fuller with some definite texture
Parting thoughts: A very well done red ale with good aspects of malt and hops.

Snuck a sample from Learys glass .. red Amber .. solid foam .. cutting meat .. red malts, chew, red crayon, bark .. mouth is solid .. all good for a red .. . . Stop being such a wanker and drink the juice!!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Hazy deep garnet red pour with soapy, eggy off-white foam. Lots of wet lace. Somehow big and chewy yet also hoppy and bright. Thick medium-dark malts. Sharp earthy citrus hops. Dark red fruit. Currants. Toffee. Molasses. Cocoa nibs. Blood oranges. Raisins. Blackberries. Plum pudding. Chipotle. Faint hints of peat and tobacco. Extraordinary!

One of the best reds Ive had. Deep reddish amber with a beuge head. Lots of lace. Very ready nose with extreme toffee and candied cherry. Some light smoky notes. Thick sticky mouthfeel, but not cloying. Spicy hop flavors are high, but bitterness is very low. Mellow malty fade.

Beautiful amber pour with a two finger tan head. Aroma is pine, citrus, caramel malt. Mouthfeel is big and thick and chewy, which is surprising for a 6.7% abv. Very nice. Taste is dank and piney, with a ever present caramel malt backbone. A delicious beer.
22 oz bottle. Deep amber red with an average off-white head. Aroma is of caramel, toffee, citrus, bubble gum, and herbal notes.Taste is of caramel, malt, oranges, light spices, and herbal hops.
Bottle. The look is reddish, beige colored head, clearish. The smell is hoppy, caramel, candy, fruit, and good. The taste is bitter, hoppy, fruit, caramel.

Pours up a hazy, redish amber with a lasting, ginger colored head. Aroma is chewy, jammy malts. Spicy, thick marmalade hops. Some melted sugar. Jellied orange. Fruity and chewy. Taste is light sweet, and fruity bitter. Smooth, fairly full mouth feel. A bit of stickiness on the lips. Gets more bitter toward the end, with a resinous, hop close. Tasty.

Bottle at home. Pours a murky reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma of sweet malts and hops, caramel, pine, resin, toffee, citrus, some chocolate as well. Taste is moderate sweet and over moderate bitter, pine, resin, caramel, chocolate, citrus, bitter pine/resiny aftertaste with some caramel and chocolate. Nice.

Oy pours bronze with an off white head. The aroma has rich toasty caramel malt, toffee, floral and soft citrus hops. It has a medium rich body with soft carbonation. The taste has spicy, floral and citrus hops and is balanced off by dry caramel and toffee malt with a bit of brightness. Solid.

Poured from 22 oz bottle into a pint glass. Egg shell, off white colored head of creamy foam. The appearance is a slightly cloudy Amber/ brownish orange. The aroma isnt as promising as lauded as on the bottle description. Nonetheless I pick up a light touch of sweet citrus and caramel malt. On the taste I get blood orange, caramel and toffee, and a pine dry finish.
Tap @ Easy Tiger. Blood red? More like deep amber. Malty with a hoppy bitter kick.

Amber with off white head - Malt and some hops in the aroma - Malt body to support hop that is fruity and herbal and gives some bitterness - The malt and herbal bitterness goes into the finish - This was good

22 oz bottle. Pours deep ruby red amber with a big fluffy light tan head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is sweet nutty caramel malts with fruity piney hops.

The flavor is sweet nutty caramel malt with a lot of fruit and a piney resiny hop finish with a little alcohol. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with low carbonation.

Overall, a nice hoppy red.

Very dark and rich in color. Hoppy aroma balanced with caramel sweetness. Complex, nutty flavors. Am a fan of Ale Smith's seasonal efforts

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bomber. This is a big bad brew with lots of depth and carmel malt sweetness. One of the best amber ales around.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a brown color with a medium sized foamy beige head that left good lacing. The aroma was somewhat bitter with a fairly harsh fruity hop note and a bit of earthiness. The flavor was bitter with harsh fruity hops, crystal malt, semi sweet dark fruit and a bit of earthiness. Medium length finish. Medium body. Meh.
Shared 22 oz. bottle. Clear dark amber with a beige head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit and caramel. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, bread, pine and caramel. Long bitter finish.

Aroma: hoppy and fruity, much more like an IPA; Appearance: clear, dark amber with frothy off white head; Taste: interesting combination of the hops and caramel maltiness; good but doesnt quite work together; Palate: medium body with long, sweet-bitter finish; Overall: not my favorite Alesmith but still pretty good.

On tap at Brunzies. Mild caramel nose with a bit of biscuit, grain, and light floral hops. Hazy dark copper brown with thin lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts fairly sweet with biscuit and caramel, medium nutty and happy bitterness. Finishes with neutral fruit. Mild nutty bitter after.

On tap at Hops & Pie. Deep reddish appearance with a lacy tan head. Aroma of resinous hops, spruce, caramel malt, light zesty citrus fruits, toffee and light bead. Similar flavor, bittersweet and balanced with a medium body and a lingering finish. Top notch amber ale (said no one ever).

Bottle. Hazy, a bit murky dark amber color with creamy tan head. Aroma is toffee, pine, chocolate, forestfloor. Taste is a toffee and sticky pine explosion, some chocolate, earthy notes as well. Bittersweet finish, oily mouthfeel. Awesome, although its not the freshest anymore - this is Amber at its best!

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4, not the freshest one. Still lots of pine aroma from the hops. Sweet and full-bodied, with a lot but smooth soft foam. Caramel, nuts, on the tongue the amber part of this ale really shines. Long pine finish. Very nice, and really what you would expect when Alesmith does an Amber, in all the best ways.

22 ounce bottle. Pours a bright copper red color topped by a large frothy beige head. Outstanding Belgian lace, as well. Toasted caramel malt nose is rich and nutty. First sip is toasted malt with caramel and birch notes. Balanced nicely with the spicy citrus hops that come through midtaste. Finishes dry and spicy with a hind of woody, herbal goodness. Take note of the 6.66% ABV.

Decent sized light orage had of varying sized bubbles. Smoked malts, sweet tarts, dark fruit and some roasted grains. Aroma a bit on the mild side. Color is an impressive dark crimson brown. Lots of dark roasted grains, bready malts, smoked terriaki beef and light hops. Pretty well balanced and very easy drinking. Light alcohol presence. Lingering roasted malts and a bit of dry hops. Amber/brown ales are easy to make and easy to drink. Alesmith, as expected, conquered another style.

The taste is fruity but also a little overripe berries. Much of ripe berries in the aroma. Amazingly bitter aftertaste which fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. It gets better the hotter it gets. But not impressed. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle. Pours mahogany towards the more red spectra, leaving a thing yellow head. Looks beautiful. Aroma is light and so is the sweetness compared to my anticipation! It has that caramel sugar hint but it is drier than many other of its kind, which heightens its drinkability on such a warm day as this.

Lukt: Frukter, rosin, krydder og lakris.
Utseende: Brun.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum., heng langs kant.
Smak: Frukter, rosin og krydder. Noe tørr smak.

Bottle. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel hoppy earthy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy piney caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy piney caramel finish.

Tap @ Kongebryg. Appearance: pours clear dark red amber with an ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, bread, pine, ligth citrus and some fruity notes. palette: strong malt and fruity yeasty aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, medium sweetness, balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and an oily texture. overall: excellent amber/red ale
Bottle a amber colored beer with a white-off head aroma malts citrus fruits pineapple spicy nuts and hops flavor malts citrus pineapple fruits nuts some caramel and bitter hops
Pours verk hazy mudbrown with a tanned light beige head. Aroma; Citrus, caramel, resin, malt, some grass, bread and pine. Taste; Citrus, resin, caramel, malt and bread.

Medium offwhite head. Clear deep red body. Perfumy dried fruit and
raisins aroma with spicy notes. Dry raisiny dried fruit and raisins
taste with mealy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dry
raisiny sooty soy sauce aftertaste with chocolatey spicy notes. Its
OK, but a bit old, bottled Oct 2014. (0.65l bottle, at Olympen, Oslo.)

650 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Unclear dark amber copper color with beige head. Malty and light hoppy aroma, caramel, light bread, light pine and grass, light citrusy too. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma with some licorice notes. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

Od razu po przelaniu pojawia się przepiękny aromat, bucha wręcz. Jest to, co lubie w Red Ale, czy cała gama przepięknych słodowych nut. Jest tu syrop klonowy, wspaniały karmel, ciasto marchewkowe, trochę skórki czarnego chleba, wszystko wkomponowane idealnie w nieziemsko zbalansowaną słodycz. W smaku znowu słodycz, aczkolwiek dochodzi niezbyt wysoka kontra goryczkowa w ziołowej postaci. Doszło jakby trochę czekolady i rodzynki, reszta tak jak w aromacie (i całe szczęście). Ogółem to piwo to poemat na temat słodów, coś co daję do myślenia, że nie tylko chmielem człowiek żyje,

24.03.2016, 0,65l bottle @ home:
Soft gusher. Big slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet foresty, wet leafs, sap, caramel malts, hops, minerals, pine needles, bark, grass, citrus peel. Taste is slightly dry and harsh foresty, weeds, leafs, bark, wet hops, minerals, pine needles, caramel malts, moss, sap, grass, burnt caramel. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough, but not really my cup of tea.

reddish dark amber colour, large, dense, quite long lasting beige-ish head; aroma of overripe fruits, caramel, biscuits, some toasted notes and moderate citruses; taste of overripe (tropical)fruits, biscuits, some roastedness and resiny notes; great amber ale

Bottle @ Fairbar, Aarhus. Pours hazy dark Amber with a light tan head. Aroma of malt, light caramel, grass, old citrusy hops. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, little bread, grass, weak citrusy hops. Medium body, average carbonation. Still nice, but a bit old. 110616
Tap @ Fairbar. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich caramel, fruits, hops, grass and malt. Sweet finish.

Dark red body with a creamy head.
Aroma and flavour are hoppy and malty, with notes of dried fruit. Dry taste with medium bitterness. Dry finish.
Medium body with soft/average carbonation.

Good, but nothing memorable. The hoppy character does not seem to match the rest of the flavour profile very well. It is also too dry for me.

Bomber. Turners, Sheffield. Lightly hazy, reddy amber. Messy, lasting, ginger coloured head. Nose has chewy, jammy malts. Spicy, thick cut marmalade hops. Some melted sugar. Jellied orange. Fruity and chewy, overall. Taste is light sweet, and fruity bitter. Smooth, fairly full mouthfeel. A bit of stickiness on the lips. Gets more bitter toward the end, with a resinous, bitter close. Tasty gear.

@ Only Good Beer Budapest // Reddish amber beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, biscuits, fruity, citrusy hops. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, berries, caramel, bready, hay, some floral notes.

duft: frisk kick af humle malt kramel. 
smag: maltet kramel frisk super frisk humle kick

Pours a deep mahogany color with medium tan head. Aroma has sweet malts, resin, nuts, caramel, citrus and pine. Taste follows the aroma, piney, nutty, caramely, resiny and citrusy, with a medium bitter finish to it.
66cl bottle from etre gourmet I think. Color is red to copper. Thin beige head. Medium bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Aroma is malty, hoppy, nutty, chocolate, resin.
Pours mahogany with a medium sized foamy off white head. Aromas of caramel, citrus, overripe apple, resin, tropical fruit. Taste is malty and musty with medium body and carbonation.

Bottle from Cornelius. Hazy amber/red body with a medium off-white head. Steady carbonation. Aroma of liquorice, pine, resin, Blackjacks and parma violets. Flavour of floral hops, resin, grapefruit, lychee and toffee. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. I do love a hoppy Amber Ale. This is my favourite one yet.

If youre having one or two, this beer is perfect. But the finish can build up on you if youre not used to a little tartness in your reds. The finish is the only knock on this otherwise fantastic ale.

Rojizo oscuro limpio y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de piña, cítricos, menta, pino, resinas y fondo maltoso de caramelo. Cuerpo medio-alto con sabor intenso cítrico, pino menta y final de amargor resinoso equilibrado.

Pours clear deep mahogany with low off-white head. Aroma of light caramel and grapefruit but heavily dominated by resin. Taste is light toffee and butterscotch with a resin bitter finish. Light to medium bodied, smooth, with soft carbonation.

22 oz bottle. Bottled on 08/21/15. Thanks to Timo A!
Cloudy red color with a small light tan head. 
Dark hops, caramel malt and sweetness in the aroma. 
Dry citrusy and resiny hops and caramel malt in the flavor. 
Balanced but really dark hopped. A bit unfresh. Were going to get you. Were going to get you. Not another peep. Time to go to sleep.
Hoppy lightly sweet aroma. Bitter citrus orange and somewhat malty. Sweet hoppy finish, grassy piny.
Nice sweet and bitter brew. Good mixture, some fruits and grassy hops. Nice one.

En effet, cest pas mal smooth et crémeux aussi.ça sent un peu étrange puis en bouche, il y a un petit côté étrange aussi, un peu comme une porter mal fagotée ou un barley wine malpoli ... Je suis pas fan. La version Saint Valentin était nettement plus sympathique

Bottle from Craigs, dregs run tasting. Pours clear dark amber with a thin, persistent white head. Aromas of caramel, grapefruit, pine. Taste is bitter, red fruit, caramel. Bittersweet finish. Enjoyed this.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep amber, nose is toffee, pine, malty, taste is dry, bitter, creamy, burnt toffee.

Pours blight brown with slight brown head

Aroma is malts and earthy

Taste is malty, earthy and grassy.
Bottle. Red with off white head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, dried fruit. Taste of dried fruit, sherry, pine, biscuit, caramel. Full bodied with a slightly bitter finish.
bottle at home ... soft copper ... soft toffee malt .. caramel toffee malt .. soft sweet toffee .. soft malts .. sweet toffee fruit .. soft toffee malts .. soft sweet roast malts ...

Bomber to a pint. Amber brown with thin off white head. Pine and orange zest. Balanced caramel and toasted malt flavor... Well done amber ale...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours reddish amber with a beige head. Mild sweet toffee malts, some fruity hops, faint pine, and some earthy notes. Fine.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren, april 4th 2015. Dark amber body with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel, booze and pine. Taste is sweet with chocolate and orange. Light bitterness, with a caramel and pine aftertaste.
Aroma of citrus, pine, and apricot. Flavors of toffee, caramel, hard fruits, and earth. Finishs malty and well balanced. Not complex but well done.

Foxy redbrown beer, veiled, under a yellow cream head. Caramel, cakebottom, rosewater, lychee, oranges, maraschino cherries. In the taste Resin, pine, bitter flavour, with almost no sweetness left. FInish/retronsasal has some caramel & rosewater again. Very rich, oozing MF, again the effect of the high resin content. Alcoholwarmth arrives as an afterthought. Excellent.
Hazy golden with a medium head. Aroma is hops, bisquit and caramel. Taste is mango, lime and caramel.

Bottle shared with karstenborg. Its an amber colored beer with a creamy off white almost beige head. The aroma is fruity hoppy. Berries and biscuit malty. Quite fruity hoppy flavor. Bitter hoppy and quite malty. Delicious!

Bottle. Poured hazy ruby amber color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy earthy hop & sweet malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations were met with a solid brew.

22oz bottle. Crystal clear garnet body topped by medium beige head, nice lacing. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, pine, caramel. Taste is moderately sweet, pine, caramel, some grapefruit. Medium body, light effervescence.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy light copper pour with a frothy beige head, aroma has autumn fruits and pine, taste has chewy sweet caramel, tangerine, some pine, hint of nuttiness.

650ml bottle from Binnys in Highland Park. Pours reddish orange with a tan-orange head leaving some spotty lacing. Aroma hits immediately with citrus and pine, then stone fruits and caramel kick in. Taste is of sweet caramel malts, tangy pine, some grapefruit, some stone fruits and chewy resin. Medium bodied with some alcohol presence. Finishes tangy fruity and piney, with a nice sweet blend, and some length. Much more a stereotypical "American Strong" ale than an amber. Sure seems that the same was said in February for My Bloody Valentine - are they different recipes? Both are quite good. 14.5
Fat på good beer, nyc. Rödaktig kulör. Trevlig doft med lite blommig humle. Aningen träig och torr smak med säd och gräs
Smakprov på good beer. Mörkt rödbrun med beige skum. Fruktig doft. Gräddig munkänsla med låg beska och hyffsad fruktigher.

Bottle 65cl / Botella 65cl.
@ Whole Foods Market 3rd and Faifax, Los Angeles, CA, USA.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Hops, resinous, malt, caramel, sweet / Lupulo, resinoso, malta, caramelo, dulce.

22FL OZ ($5.99) this was a cool find. this brewery really knows how to craft unique character for their beer. none of the stuff they do taste like the competition. another very good beer. red is dark and hazy and tastes pretty damn good.

Draught at Congegration Ale House, Long Beach, California. Reddish amber beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, biscuits, fruity, citrusy hops. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, berries, caramel, bready, hay, some floral notes. Quite pleasant.
A very nice well balanced red. Pours a beautiful clear red with a tan head. Smells of pine, grapefruit, vanilla. Taste is similar, lots of vanilla balanced by some nice hops. Had in the bottle.
Bottle. Pours a reddish dark amber with a nice layer of beige head. Aroma and taste are bread malts, caramel, floral hops, and pine.

22 oz bottle at jcos place, 10.30.15. Pours a mahogany color with a thick beige head and heavy lace. Caramel and toffee malts, some bread, with a strong fruity hop presence and a bit of pine. Good balance from the strong malty presence and aa decently big hoppy feel. Really quality brew. I dont drink enough Alesmith. I should drink more of their beers.

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish brown with a fluffy off-white head. Aromas of toffee and pine. Flavors are sweet caramel, toffee, slight nuttiness, bready tones, pine, bitter citrus and slight herbal notes in the finish. Noticeable alcohol warmth. Creamy mouthfeel with some prickliness from the resiny hops. Rich and decadent. Complex and very nice!
Roasted malt flavors of caramel, subtle citrus, gritty undertones of chalk and a finish of spicy hops and baked bread.
Bomber shared with dusty and Brian...this is one of the best ambers i have ever enjoyed...really like the alesmith brews...solid brewery no doubt.
Pours a clear copper color with a malted caramel aroma. Taste is bready and malty with a decent caramel backbone. Slight bitter aftertaste with a lasting coating on the tongue.

Deep clearish Amber, beautiful, with a rocky/foamy beige head of decent size. Amazing aroma with huge caramel, toffee, and Amber malt stickiness, with a stern floral and orange zest and slightly pine resiny stickiness as well. Big floral resiny hoppy flavor with a wee bit of crisp pine, but also with a load of sweet Amber malts. Really lovely. Very balanced and complex.
A very hoppy red. Great deep color that matches as stated. Flavors are complex with a huge hops takeover. A little citrus and some nuts but hops ate the only things that stick. Tap

Bomber. Caramel and toffee malt aroma with floral hop notes. Pours ruby reddish-amber colored with one finger of tan head with excellent retention and some lacing. Starts with sweet toffee and caramel malt flavors to go with a slick mouthfeel. Finishes smooth and just a touch dry with floral hops neutralizing the malt sweetness nicely and balancing out the beer. Excellent red ale.

Bottle. Deep ruby-hued amber with a medium tan head. Aroma is hoppy with abundant caramel, toffee notes, sweet malt, light chocolate and dark bread. Taste is sweet malt, fruit hops, floral hops, herbal notes, caramel, light toffee, dark bread and cocoa. Body is medium with a chewy carbonation and lingering hop bitterness. Ends with more caramel, dark bread, toffee notes, floral hops, citrus, cocoa and herbal notes.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into a glass. Hazy Crimson with small beige head. Aroma is dank, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt, herbal hops, and bitter finish.

Caramel, thistle, and pineapple nose. Oak and grapefruit also present, but with a nice sharp bite. Hazy rust, medium firm orange head, nice lacing. Oak, nuts, caramel, and grapefruit. Full body, soft carbonation. Wonderful beer, among my favorite ambers.

Great aroma of fruity, caramel sweetness, cascade like hops, a bit toasted malts. Flavor is not typical american amber- rather close to brown ale with distinctive toasted malts in vanguard. Sweetish and bitter, some dryness in aftertaste. Some bits of balancing sourness. Pours dark brown to coppery. Medium body. A bit darker malts overwhelmed in flavor balance for me. 
Tasty, but if I grub a bottle of amber, I expect it to be amber, so -1 overall.
Tap at Busters. Murky reddish orange pour with a wispy off white head. Caramel, pine, and citrus. Good body. Nice hop bite. Really good.

Dark amber with medium creamy beige head. Slight roasted malt and bitter herbs aroma. Simultaneous slight herbal bitterness and roasted malt taste with some bread sweetness, dry and bit dusty. Slight bitter aftertaste with bread notes.

Pours a burnt reddish amber color with an off white head. Caramel, toffee, toast, earthy hop, floral and biscuit aroma. Caramel, toffee, earthy hop, toast, herbal, pepper and biscuit flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a caramel, toffee and hop finish.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a dark reddish color with a thick, khaki colored head. Aroma of red malts and citrus hop notes. Some pine, some fruit notes. Flavor is bitter and dry with some toasted malt and fruity hop notes. Full bodied, lively carbonation. Lingering bitter finish. Pretty cool

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Belle couleur ambrée rubis. Fine mousse. CO2 moyen. Belle bouche maltée, pointe de caramel, superbement équilibrée. Rondeur et douceur côtoient le grain et l'alcool. Tres belle bière.

Last bottle from FLBC. Pours dark red, off white head, spotty lacing. Aroma is rye. Flavor is bready malt, rye, black tea. Very creamy mouthfeel, but decently carbonated. Dry, bittering finish. Excellently balanced beer. Happy Halloween.

22oz bottle from Dominion Beer and Wine pours a murky, garnet amber with some sudsy, off white head. Nose has a lot of orange, both juice and rind, plenty of soap and pine too, some definite cracker/biscuit too, maybe a little earthy honey comb. Flavor follows right along, the malt backbone is caramel and biscuit, almost a little bit of cocoa powder too, orange, soap, pine, dried herbs. Full bodied, bitter but also dry.

Fonefan 110415. Red brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is hop, berries, malt, peaches, floral, caramel, bread . Flavour is hop, berries, malt, peaches, floral, caramel, bread, raisin, pine, orange. Nice beer.

(bottle) Pours a, well, red color with a medium light tan head. Aroma of powdered Tang explodes out of the glass. Further scents of juicy navel orange, tangerine, and perhaps lychee fruit as well are perceived. This is a citrus explosion. The underlying malts mixed with the citrus hops throw off a bit of an iced tea vibe as well. The flavor is heavier on the malt than expected, with some sweet caramel coming through pretty strong that is coupled with a bready component that when combined is propelled into sweet roll harbor. After rolling out of sweet roll harbor the flavor turns hard to starboard and is awash in an orange juice wake. Post orange juice turns to resinous and tea-like hops that clean up the sweetness quite well. Could be a lingering prune note in the far finish. Mouthfeel is medium and carb is dialed in. Overall this is another unsurprisingly solid beer from a very consistent brewery.

Bottle. As advertised, this is a ghoulish, murky red with a giant top. It has a strong essence of caramel malt. This drinks with a sweet malty character, toffee and sugar over the top. (#6041, 10/4/2015)

From bomber to tulip. Overt caramel and toffee malts. Hazy red with off-white head that lingers and leaves nice lacing. Taste is predominantly malt (bready) with a pronounced pine secondary flavor. Crystal malt leaves a sweetness on the palate long after the beer is finished. Moderate high bittering comes out late as a spike on the tongue.
Bomber->SA. Amber with big frothy tan head. A: lots of caramel malt, some citrus hops. T: similar, with lingering bitterness. Decent.

Amber pour. Beige head.
Caramel, woody hop and light citrus.
More citrus in the flacour Bready and toasty malt body with a woody finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light citrus and good malt backbone. Nice barley and very nice drinking all around. Pours dark maroon with good head. Crisp barley bitter finish. Tasted at Whole Foods.

I swear Ive rated this before. Regardless, this is a 22 oz bottle purchased from The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma on this is really nice with some herbal an floral hop notes. Significant caramel malt sweetness is also present. A little toasty, too. Really nice. Pours a transparent beautiful garnet-amber colored body with a fluffy, strong light orange head present. Starts with a bit of a smooth, velvety texture. Some caramel malt sweetness follows, along with some toastiness. FInishes with a mild, earthy hoppiness. Long toasted nuttiness is also present. Perhaps a touch of diacetyl.

Bomber from Beer Run. Clear dark brow, large foamy tan head. Good retention. Aroma of toffee, resin and piney hops. The taste is toffee malts, resiny hops. a bit of pine and citrus. Medium bodied, moderate bitterness. Well balanced, drinkable.

Pours a dark, reddish-brown, with good-sized, lasting head. Aroma is full of citrus from the hops. Flavor is very citrusy, with some sweetness from the malt and roasted grain. Tastes more like an IPA than an amber ale, and thats a good thing. Glad I got to try it.

Bomber from Uptown. Pours a clear ruby, very bright color with a medium white head. A big sweet caramel, toast berry nose. Fruity, fresh rich sweet hops, some bitterness, slick, soapy, very flavorful. Damn good. Awesome amber.

Brown-maroon colored body. The aroma is a punchy and floral torrent with a backbone of caramelized hops. So too the body is juicy,citrus punchy, and floral, Nice, full mouthfeel, with juicy bitterness on the finish, all across a sturdy caramel malt backbone. Feels stronger than the 6.66% ABV. Theres a lot of flavor packed in this one.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a dark red caramel color with a khaki head that settles to a thin film and sudsy collar. Aroma is bitter citrus hops caramel malt and a little herbal notes. Taste is bitter citrus hops and malt little sweet and subtle spice with some earthy herbal flavors in the finish.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2015 AleSmiths Halloween beer, with the symbolical 6.66% ABV, zombie-themed label and blood red colour, so to speak. Vintage bottle from last year. Thick and dense, frothy, yellowish egg-white, lacing head over a hazy brownish copper coloured beer. Pleasant aroma of grapefruit peel, old cheese (deteriorating hops), toasted bread, passion fruit, soap, ginger, pumpkin soup, nutmeg, dried leaves, dried orange peel, hazelnuts and something undisturbingly iron-like. Crisp onset of dried fruits, hints of apricot and vague pineapple but very restrained, soft carbonation; smooth caramelly, toasted and nutty maltiness in the middle, bittersweetish with a sharpish edge, finishing in long, drying, peppery, citrus peel-like as well as cheesy and a little bit metallic, followed by earthy hop bitterness, yet not too harsh, i.e. allowing toasted and caramelly malt bittersweetness to pass through. Has undoubtedly lost some of its hops fragrancy in the meantime but still a characterful, enjoyable sipper.

Sample at September THT
Thin creamy amber head. Hazy amber pour. A decent beer but not as good as their usual beers

Bottle at THT. Dark Amber with short lasting off white head. Lots of resin, lime peel, some soft sweet malts and a touch of toffee, but mosltly just massive dank resinous hops. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied.

Bottle at THT. Pours hazy red brown with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, toffee, overripe dark fruit and raisins. Flavour is over moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sampled from bottle @ Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist tasting. Clear dark amber color, average to medium sized off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, some hops, a hint of caramel and leaves with a decent bitter finish. Hmm not as good as expected.
Bottle at THT. Clear amber pour with white head. Aroma is super malty, fruity, caramel, toasty, fruity. Taste is super sweet, caramel. Palate is med full bodied, sweet, cloying. Meh.

A reddish copper ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with smooth floral hops, light treacle, smooth and balanced. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with balanced floral hops, resinous character, grapefruit pulp, light treacle, very nice. On tap at brewery.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Red ipa, herbal, some spice, fruit and earthy hop aromas. Flavors in hop profile are similar to the aromas, very much red ipa, as it warms it becomes less drinkable.

22 oz bottle pours a hazy caramel copper color. Aroma is caramel, toffee, light citrus / pine. Taste is sweet caramel malty with an orange rind tang, a little alcohol comes through and the finish makes me think of turpentine. Body is active, dense and thick. Respectable.

Bottle shared in London. Pours clear amber with a creamy, off-white head. The nose holds caramel, light aged pine, grainy bread. Medium sweet flavor with lots of oily pine, grains, alcohol, earth and orange rind. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Rindy and resinous to finish, lightly boozy, with toasted grain sweetness. OK.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2015 Przepiękne opakowanie ! Jedno z lepszych jakie widziałem w życiu. Malowana etykieta stylizowana na amerykańskie plakaty filmowe z lat 50tych. A co w środku - po otwarciu kapsla eksplozja słodkich czerwonych owoców, w połączeniu z żywicznością lasu, toffi, karmelem. Można wąchać godzinami. W smaku nie gorzej, solidna słodowa baza (karmel, biszkopt, ciasto owocowe to pierwsze skojarzenia, daje dobrą bazę dla rozwijających się chmielowych aromatów (żywica, cytrus, słodkie owoce) i świetnej goryczki (odczuwalnej przynajmniej na 50, a nie 24 ibu). 
Wspaniałe wielowymiarowe piwo. Przyjemność sama w sobie.
Klare dunkel orangebraune Farbe, große beige Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv malzig, sehr hopfig, reife Früchte. Geschmack nach reifen roten Beeren, sehr malzig, Karamell, sehr hopfig, bitter.

Bue en bouteille de 66cl à la brasserie.
Couleur ambrée qui tire clairement sur le rubis, mousse moyenne tout comme leffervescence.
Nez sur le caramel,
En bouche attaque sur la caramel, le café, le malt fraichement moulu, puis fin de bouche sur le poivre et le clou de girofle excellent équilibre et (et de très loin) la meilleure ambrée que jai bu.

And alesmith did it again.. Awesome balance between huge maltiness, caramel and loads of hops, mostly citrusy, but I love that pine kick. Moderate to intense sweetness, moderate bitterness with strong and quite long bittersweet finish. . Kinda reminds me of barleywine, but still - awesome amber

Bottle. Teku glass. Deep red with medium to high semi-densed head. Good head retention. Medicore lacing. Nice high malty (caramel) aroma, bready, nice fruity hoppy aroma, little ashy. Taste is moderately heavy sweet, with some nice medium bitterness in the end. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture, Finish is long and bitter.
It pours brown with a medium brown head that produces lots of lacing. There are aromas of caramel, citrus, and bread. It has a sweet caramel taste with dried fruits, pine, citrus, and bread.
65 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy reddish amber with an off-white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, resin, and orange rind - with a bitter finish.

Bottle 22fl.oz. [ As AleSmith Evil Dead Red ].Clear medium to dark red amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, dusty malt, bread, moderate to heavy hoppy, warm hops - fruity. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, dusty, caramel, hoppy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20150411]

Barwa rubinowa. Piana beżowa, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa z niezłym lacingiem. W aromacie na pierwszy plan wybija się żywica a nastepnie owoce i sporo karmelu i gdzies tam w tle majaczy miód. W smaku piwo oferuje podobne wrazenia jak w aromacie, goryczka jest dosc wysoka ale krótka i bardzo przyjemna. Można wyczuć sporo ciała, jednak piwo jest dość gładkie i bardzo pijalne.
Bottle split a few ways. Dark amber pour with a frothy head. Dank, hoppy, caramel, dark malts, grapefruit with a sweet ending.
Bottle at home - Movie night with Morten. Clear deep dark red/brown - offwhite head. Caramel. Fruity. Ok hoppy. Resin. Nice bitterness. Light fatness. Citrus. Nice.

Butelkowane było 9/9/2014. 
Aromat i smak chmielu jest wciāż ciekawy i bogaty. Przede wszystkim ułożony i pasuje mi to bo coraz bardziej odpychajā mnie perfumowane amerykanami chmielami IPy. 
Tutaj chmiele świetnie podkreślajā słody. Nuty to toffee, palony karmel i kopiko bo sporo cukierkowości jest w tym piwie. Do tego koktailowe wisienki Marachino i sporo innych kandyzowanych owoców tropikalnych. 
Ogólnie jest to piwo średnio gęste, delikatnie nasycone. Łatwe w piciu o profilu podobnym do bardziej bogatego słodowo ESB dochmielinego na amerykańsko. 
Jest spoko.

Bottle from Beergium. Deep red color, beige head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, toffee, hops, nuts, resin and a bit of grass. Bitter finish with citrus, caramel, resin, hops and grass. Excellent brew.

Piękny aromat żywiczny połączony ze słodkim karmelem i leciutką owocową nutą. W smaku jeszcze lepiej i jeszcze intensywniej, smakuje jak lekko karmelowy sok z żywicy , porządna, krótka i arcyprzyjemna goryczka, gładkie i pełne, do tego niezwykle pijalne. Rzeczywiście, trudno wyobrazić sobie lepsze piwo w tym stylu.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/20/2014. Pours slightly hazy deep ruby red color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, caramel, toffee, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, light nuttiness/chocolate, and floral/grassy earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/pine hops and moderate dark/bready malt sweetness; with good strength. Taste of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, caramel, toffee, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, light nuttiness/chocolate, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate pine/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon/orange zest, pine, caramel, toffee, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, light nuttiness/chocolate, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/piney hops and moderate dark/bready malt sweetness; with a good malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice red ale. All around great robustness, complexity, and balance of citrus/pine hops and dark/bready malt sweetness; and very smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

66 cl bottle @ lusikka. Bottled 10.08.2014. Aroma has hayish tones, resiny tones, caramel and toffee. Also some pine. Flavour has vanilla, woody notes, baking stuff, resiny hops and toffee. Not as sweet as anerican reds usually. But sweet anyway.

650 ml bottle. Pours a dark amber colour with a small head. Aroma of red berries, caramel, grains and some wood. Flavour of sweet caramel, red berries, grains, grassy hops and and wood. Medium bodied. Alcohol warms. Not as fresh as it should be.

650ml bottle from Beergium
Bottled 08/10/14 - Pours dark copper reddish with a massive foamy head. Aroma of caramely malts, toffee, syrup, hints of piney hops and grass. Taste is sweetish, caramely and malty with loads of toffee, syrup, hints of resin, pine and grass. Finish is smooth, malty and hoppy with some syrup, toffee and caramel. Not very fresh anymore, but still okay.

65 cl bottle.
Pours clear mahogany color with a huge off-white head. Very resinous and piney aroma, some sweet hops, sweet fruits and caramel malts. Sweet and malty, some resinous hops with caramel notes. Quite good but definitely not the best Amber Ale Ive tasted.
4514
MrOrla meets Shaun Hill. Pours Cloudy amber with am off-white head. Aroma and taste of Malts, toffe, dark fruits, licorice.
(bottle 15/05-2015) low beige head, clear amber red color, hoppy aroma, smooth caramel hoppy taste, some bitterness, DIPA meets red ale, really well made. Bottled on 09/10/14.

C4PAF pre-tasting. Hazy deep red copper with a lasting off-white head. Sweet malty aroma with dried fruit and red berries. Sweet malty flavour with lots of caramel, biscuit and toffee, dried fruit and berries.

Bottle @ Mr.Orla meets Shaun Hill, Odense. Pre C4 Pale Ale Festival, 2015. Pours Cloudy amber with a frothy head. Caramel and Dark fruit. Some hops and even licorice. Chewy! Full bodied. Bitter finish. Good!
Bottle at tasting. Dark red pour. Aroma of hop, pine and caramel. Taste of caramalt, pine, amber malt and some iron. Good hoppy amber ale, but a bit too malty.
Garnet red some tan head. Aroma of british hops, cherry wax lips, pine. Tastes sweet also resinous, slight sulfur. Intense amber. A little too intense. earthy hops

A reddish brown beer, a head is quite big and beige. Aroma has caramel malts, pine and some wood. Taste has caramel malts, wood, some pine needles, medium bitterness, quite fresh. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Caramel and nice bitterness, not so special.

Bottle split at CBC Clerko, 15/04/15, thanks to Bropey.
Reddish amber topped with a decent beige covering.
Nose is candied fruit peel, earthy notes, bitter orange, caramel malt, light smoke waftings.
Taste comprises caramel, bubblegum, brown sugar, candied orange peel, light vanilla, orange blossom, trace of spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with an earthy hop rinse.
Decent hoppy amber but no game changer for the style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 15th April 2015Craft Clerkenwell. Bruces UK Swan Song. Clear deep red - amber beer, good pale tan head. Palate is airy and a little soft, mild fine carbonation. Light cream in the malt, trace of caramel. Nice smooth hop skunk followed by mild pine and marmalade. A whisper of hop spice. Airy semi dry finish. Nicely joined up and drinkable but the worlds best Amber?

Bottle, 6.66%. Dark amber/brown with medium beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted, hop,m grapefruit and pine. Flavour is malt, caramel, medium sweet, little toasted, hop, pine, little nut and bitter.
Evident caramel malts in aroma, along with some pine hop character. Flavor is slightly sweet with bitter finish.

Bottle, 22oz. A reddish colored beer, close to brown and with a dense, beige head and some lacings. Its malty on the nose, with caramel, raisins, some bread and lots of piney, orangey hops. Its full-bodied, faintly warming, pleasantly carbonated and with a nice sweetness. Bitterness, pine cones, oranges and caramel malts. Raisins. Lasting finish. Damn tasteful, dangerously easy drinkable. 150418

Bottle. Pours dark amber with a big off-white head. Aroma of peach, some floral notes, cheesy hops, some caramel and bread. Flavor is sweet and malty with some chocolate, floral notes, citrus and grains. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 650ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, orange, grape and pine. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel, orange, grape and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottled:Sweet, malty, fruity flavor of toffee and caramel. Soft and round. A little hop pops up at the end. Amber Ale is not my favorite style, but this was quite ok.
66 cl. bottle. Dark amber colour with an white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, spice, fruit and caramel.

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy ruby colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, caramel, pine needles and cookies.
Sweet and fruity flavor of caramel, hops and licorice with notes of pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

Aroma and taste is citrus fruity and sweet malty, some caramel, toffee, some marmalade, very nice herbal hoppy notes leading to a great bitter finish.
22 fl oz bottle. Pours cloudy orange to brown with a small tan head. Aroma is pine hoppy, toffee and herbal. Bitter, toffee and caramelish. Smooth roasted. Caramelish. Bitter and toffee dense malty.
Poured from bottle into shaker glass. Dark brownish red, murky. Hops aroma and finish, medium bodied maltiness. Very good.

Bottle. Blood red body with tan head. Aroma is slightly roasted malts with carame, vanilla and some dried fruits. Taste is roasted malts with fruits and caramel and hints of pines. Aftertaste is slightly roasted caramel malts with some fruits and some nice hoppy bitterness. Very nice one.

Location/Date:Bottle on 2/14/2015 shared with Dave.
Appearance: Pours dark red maroon.
Aroma: Aroma of caramel, pine.
Taste: Medium bitterness, caramel.
Palate:Medium body.
Summary: I always enjoy a nice hoppy amber ale. Pretty good, though Yulesmith Winter is still my all time fav.

Bottle shared at Bruces farewell drinks. Clear reddy amber coloured pour with a small cream head. Aroma is nice big nutty, little praline, red berry, warming alcohol. Flavour is composed of rounded nutty, honey on toast, tart red berry, hint of spicy rye. Palate is medium full, moderate to high carbonation. Nice and rounded. Lovely.

Bottle shared at Craft. It pours clear deep red-amber with a decent yellow-white head. The nose is bitter-sweet, toffee, pine, varnish, resin, dried fruits and fruit bun. The taste is bitter-sweet, wood, toasted, earth, varnish, pepper, toffee, resin, pine, light pepper, faint citrus and mild astringency with a drying finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. A bit more malty than expected, but rather drinkable.

Brun skum råhvid tæt kort
Chokolade nødder citrus humlle malt korn 
Bitter modrate sød modrate 
Tør blød
@f1
Cloudy mahogany color with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit, and hint of caramel. Fruity flavor with caramel, nuts, and grapefruit with some hop bite. Very nice beer.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy reddish amber with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110415

Bottle @ Post-Easter Procrastination, Ulfborg. Pours hazy ruby amber with airy beige head. Clear aroma of fruit and malt, with notes of caramel. Sweetish flavour of fruit and caramel malt, with notes of hops and touches of citrus. Sweetish and citric aftertaste. Decent.
nut coffee, caramel aromas, dark brown wit red hint, a fine brown head. medium bitter, light sweet. lively carbonation, medium bodied, and a light nutty aftertaste.

22oz bottle 4/10/15 (Sam?js Bottle Shop) Pours a hazy amber with a small tan head. Aroma of hops, malt, caramel, and toffee. Taste of the same with more malt and sweetness. This medium to full bodied brew is well balanced and is tasty.
Flaske: Lidt lysere i farven end sin fætter og ikke så kraftig i smag og mundfylde. Mere ordinær og ikke så kraftig men stadig en lækker øl. Fornemt alesmith.
on tap poured into a pint glass..amber/ruby with a fluffy white head..aroma of caramel,pine,resin,florals..hoppy,earthy,sticky,cr done.

Bottled on 2014-10-09. Clear chestnut brown with a medium sized beige frothy head. Hoppy nose; pine, citrus, cheese. Mellow and soft with soft toasted malt, light bready, light caramel/toffee, pine, wood, nuts, citrus. Medium body, soft on the palate, pleasant finishing bitterness. Ok.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours hazy ruby with a thick off-white head. Aroma is pine, grapefruit, malt, caramel and a little nutty.Flavour is medium bitter and medium sweet. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Finish is earthy and dry.

20-MAR-2015, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Red, Hazy, lasting tan head.
Aroma is hoppy and malty, orange, grape fruit, caramel. Taste the same. A perfect red ale where hte balance between fresh hops and sweet caramel is great. 
Sweet, bitter, medium++ body, medium carbonation. Much like the Yulesmith (Winter). Seems more imperial than the 6% implies.

Bottled. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, pine and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent brew.

Just realized that I should have consumed this much sooner than now. Deep reddish ruby pour with some haze and 2+ fingers of thick khaki yellow head. The hop character in the nose has grown herbal and earthy with a little time and the bready malt profile shows upfront. Lightly chalky quality. Medium forward bitterness resembling citrus rind with a light fruit skin acidity. Moderate body with a piney quality and moderate sweetness. Light resinous quality on the finish.

Reddish brown color with a medium sized, light tan head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, floral hops, some toffee malts. Taste of citrus, grass, light pine, toast, toffee, tropical fruits, and a hoppy finish.

draft at Alesmith. Nose is light pine and citrus along with sweet caramel. Lightly hazy reddish amber with a small beige head. Flavor is pine and caramel combining with light bitterness and a little sweetness.

On tap @ 10 East - 
Aroma - big time hop aroma, citrus and pine resin. Some table sugar like sweetness also wafting up from the beer. Appearance - rusty brown body, nearly no head, but after some agitation its off-white and has minimal staying power. Flavor - Supremely balanced between sweet and bitter. Depth of flavor, each sip brings an array of different flavors. Excellent beer.

22 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Bottled 8/27/2014. Mostly clear red/amber with two fingers of whitish brown head. Aromas of toasty notes, biscuit, caramel, malt. Tastes of biscuit, toasty and nutty notes, caramel, malt, light floral notes, candied and dried fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

22 oz. bottle from The Hop Yard, Raleigh, NC. Reddish orange pour with a frothy beige head. Lovely aroma of tangerine, tropical fruit, wet grass, and caramel. Taste offers plenty of citrus hop flavor but with a sturdy, sweet malt backbone. Finishes with orange, chocolate, and toffee. It the alcohol content were higher this would probably fall into the American Strong Ale category because thats the only area where this does not fit there. Great beer!

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is toast and nutty malt, dates, earthy and woody hops. Flavor is toast malt, dates, light earthy and woody hops, light bitterness and apple esters with a sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draft at the brewery. Pours clear copper brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like nutty malt, strong booze, dried fruits, earthy, and very roasted. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like booze, dried fruits, and nutty roasted malt.

Look: pours a dark red. Very clear. Off white head. 
Smell: slight coco. Caramel malt. Tropical fruit. Grapefruit.
Taste: malt. Slight grapefruit bitterness.

Malty cereal aroma. Pours clear red with a white head. Malty flavors abound with a long grain finish.

(bottle - 22 oz) Deep dark amber pour with white head. Pine resin and big malt in the aroma with a citrus hop undertone. Bitter hops at the start with no trace of the citrus that I got from the aroma. Surprisingly clean finish though. Very mild aftertaste.

Ridiculously deep amber coloured body with a very nice ruby glow and a thick, four centimetre tall tan head - looks great. Aroma of alcohol, toasted malt, toffee, rich citrus, some light grapefruit and a bunch of caramelised sugars, all with a bready and thick smell. Medium-bodied; Assertive hop character that shows some resin and pine at first then mellows out to a grapefruit and citrus character and then finishes with a good pungent maltiness and a relatively mild sweet flavour. Aftertaste shows a good bite with the malt coming out most and some alcohol and toffee flavours, but the hops show up at the very tail end. Overall, a good amber for sure, and a nice beer all around; Not to the level of most other beers from AleSmith, but a great drink and definitely nice to sample! I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Whole Foods in New York, New York (Bowery) on 21-November-2013 for US$7.99 sampled at home in Washington on 10-February-2014 a couple of days before heading back up to New York.

2013 bottle drank a few months old Feb 2014. Pours bright copper with a big rocky tan head long lasting with great lace. The aroma is a big blast of dank and fruity sweet hops on a caramel and soft grain canvas. The flavor is at at first nicely meshed full sweetness and strong bitterness with the latter emerging with strong pine, light and not unpleasant metal, spice, red currants without the tartness, and riding out into a long deep blunted clean bitterness. The feel is full but not heavy, lightly soap and soft, though lingers with a bit of spice and stickiness. This is my first proper beer after 5 weeks off drinking and its a lovely welcome and firm hop handshake. Thanks Alesmith.

[Bottle (660ml)] Pours a deep ruby-amber with a large lasting frothy beige head. Some lacing on the glass. Nice aroma of hops, citrusy and earthy, along with some fruit, bready caramel malt and light sugary notes. 650ml bottle. Pours a clear amber red with an off-white, film and ring head. Aroma has big notes of grapefruit, dark fruits, yeast, and a malty, breadyness. The aroma is just as the description says, very well-balanced hops and sweet malt. A little roast, citrus, pine. Taste starts out sweet malty for me then turns more bitter, but with glistens of sweetness here and there. Fairly dry, hoppy/bitter finish, with a decent amount of pine.

650 mL bottle. The hazy brown colour is not so pretty, but it has a nice brown head to it. It has the typical, beautiful, brown sugar and hops aroma - smells big enough to be an ASA. The flavour is big for the abv, and it is hoppier than some ambers. Not too sweet, either. Lovely, lovely beer.

Very dark burgundy pour. Some red highlights. Full khaki head. Juicy fruity hop aroma typical of Alesmiths hoppy beers. Malt is rich and complex. Straddles the line between chocolatey dark flavors and bright juicy red fruit. The finish is where the tropical fruit flavors are allowed to show up. Bitterness is quite mild, but balance is well maintained. Very tasty and enjoyable. I always feel like its cheating when an amber/red ale is overly hopped to the pointt that it doesnt really fit the style. This one has the malt to back it up and really feel like it should just be categorized as an American Strong Ale.

nearly clear copper pour with a 1 finger, oily yellow cake head. Aroma is loaded with caramel and toffee, with some nice, pine, citrus and spicy hops and a little toast and biscuit. Bottle. A reddish color with a white head. A rich malty and cherry fruit aroma with a toasty toffee finish.

Bomber. Dark amber colored in appearance with a generous cap of tan head. Mostly caramel malt, pine, citrus and floral hops in the aroma. Bottle... Poured dark amber/reddish with a moderate, nice lasting head. Nice resinous hops in both aroma and flavor. Big malty flavor, mildly nutty and toasty. All that balanced the bitterness fairly well. Deep, resinous, pepper-spiced hops seemed to be the star here.

My Bottom Line:
As drinkable as it is characterful, this cousin of Arrogant Bastard delights with its able juxtaposition of coniferous hoppiness and fruit jam-laced caramel, leading to a toasty and earthy second half.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the deep red sheen.
-The mouthfeel is slender and cuddly, which helps drinkability greatly.
-The flavor profile is balanced.
-Alesmith can do no wrong, it seems.
